Reviews.Title: “avoid this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: asnaka
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before my trip but l had no choice but to stay there because l couldn't find another hotel, me and my husband got to culebra and the hotel is right across the ferry which is great but if you can get closer to flamenco beach is better because there's no nice beaches around the ferry, anyway l did the check in, and this really sketchy american was on charge of the hotel, to me she looked like a crack head, l got the key and got into the room, it was big l stayed at the "turtle room #8" l have to say it was clean, there's AC but it was very weird that both of the windows did not have a crystal only this moskito net and shutters, so the AC air escaped from the windows and the room was never cold, the hotel has very strict rules, if you loose the towel you pay 80.00, if you move the bed you pay 80.00, if you loose the keys you pay 200.00, if you loose the blankets 100.00 so ridiculous like if they worth that... the decor was horrible, l think the hotel was super price for what it was, did not inlcude any meal, but the worst of it the only reason l ask people not to stay there is because: YOU WON'T SLEEP!!! our first night l had a nightmare about being bombed in Iraq, the reason why was because people keep slamming the doors all night, the doors apparently won't close unless you slam them, and they are metal doors so imagine the noise, and every weekday they will have music at the bar downstairs until midnight, but on the weekends until 4:30 there's karaoke and it gets louder and louder, there was also a dog barking all day, there's no soundproof of any type, and there's also no TV, the island is so boring after sunset there's nothing to do, the food is horrible also, so my advise if you stay there bring your ipad, and earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Noisy”
Reviews.Author: dls99
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Friday thru Sunday. I should first say I slept great on Sunday, no noise that I know of, but also I was exhausted from the very little sleep I got over weekend. There have karaoke downstairs on Fri and Sat and it was almost hard to believe how loud it was in my room. It went really late at night. I bought earplugs the next day and STILL could hear the singing. To top it off once you get to sleep, the bar two doors down brings out some mega speakers and blasts music off an on throughout the day, so no nap can be had. It was pretty awful. The mattress was covered in plastic with the sheet over this, pretty weird and undesirable. It is the only cheap option I found on the island, maybe their more expensive rooms are better?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Beautiful Area of the World”
Reviews.Author: ClaireNovotny
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are excellent. They were more than generous with us, we felt very comfortable and welcomed. I believe the owners recently bought the place and they are making renovations to the building. It's looking good! Sorry, no pictures.. The location is great and the island is absolutely amazing. If you're looking for budget accommodations this is a very good option, plus they can help arrange snorkeling, boat trips, etc for an affordable price. We went snorkeling! Thanks for everything Mike!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: It's not nice, but its a cheap bed...the music is loud until late at night... but that's fine with me, I sleep better with music playing and there are no TV's in the room to listen to otherwise. Its a cheap place to stay, warm showers, right off the ferry, good location. Minimal accommodations. Office staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Guy is nice but needs to step it up a little”
Reviews.Author: Mrmotomike
Reviews.Content: Small older rooms . The owner is cool , but disorganized . Small island so they don't have to try and it shows , if you can boook any thing else will work , but don't expect much

Reviews.Title: “Loud & uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: MotoGoobie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located above a bar by the ferry terminal. Easy to find, but very noisy. In the morning people were load & at night the bar was load. The bed felt like a rock. When we arrived at 4pm, it took us an hour to find the manager & another 3 hours to get the room cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “An insult to true Hotels and even great "posadas"”
Reviews.Author: Eralrebeca
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here unless nowhere else to stay, I doubt you won't find another place any time of the year. There are plenty of great places for even less money with good accomodations and excellent customer service. All the qualities that this place lacks. Beds are uncomfortable, like sleeping on cement, construction going on all day starting at 7am every day. Noone to provide room keys unless you find the Housekeeping lady and ask for assistance (very good lady that is not paid enough to handle all the problems in this so called hotel). It is just an insult to hotels, and even posadas in the island and to the customers. It should be fined by agencies. Internet parties promoting their service should reconsider eliminating it from their system e.g (booking.com). We had reservations, fully paid, for 6 days inthis place but decided to leave after the third day and pay for a real hotel in the beautiful island of Culebra. I decided to meet with owner to give feedback and he did not care about it. His answer was "OK", off course the room was fully paid, he only cared about the money, no customer satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if every place else is booked.”
Reviews.Author: BruinPlayer
Reviews.Content: I can give it two stars simply because it's across the street from the ferry dock which makes getting a ticket for the early ferry a bit easier. We stayed here our last night simply because our primary hotel was already full. Manager seemed a bit perturbed that we interrupted his dinner with our arrival; the room could not be kept cool by the tiny air conditioner; bar below rocked well into the night . . . There is potential here: the room obviously had some recent remodeling done, but management would do better to get better mattresses and pay attention to the little things like: how about a 5-cent bar of soap for the bathroom? We spent all our time on the island out and about, so room quality is not a priority for us, but we couldn't get a decent night's rest here....

Reviews.Title: “College dorm room-like accomodations”
Reviews.Author: philhelb
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is its location across from the ferry terminal on Culebra. You can always get a taxi and can walk to restaurants. The worst thing is the noise from the bar downstairs and the noisy, lame air-conditioning makes it impossible to sleep on weekends. This hotel is in need of a MAJOR make-over. Windows don't close, furniture is stained and gross, miss-matching toilet seats if you can even believe that. It's the CHEAPEST place on the island for a reason. Everyone on the island felt sorry for us when we told them we were staying here. Don't do it. We arrived at mid-day only to find that NO hotel staff there to check us in until 4pm! We lost a half day. There is NO room service. This hotel totally DOESNT CARE. Beware - you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “The worst. Don't stay here unless you're desperate - completely desperate.”
Reviews.Author: kmross1
Reviews.Content: Hard old beds with a plastic cover that make them really uncomfortable. Sketchy power so the AC sometimes goes out. Water barely warm. Bar downstairs is ridiculously, uncomfortably, MASSIVELY LOUD with KARAOKE on weekends until 3:30 a.m. We couldn't even sleep with special earplugs in. Bar owners are totally inconsiderate. And there's no one there at the Kokomo to help you if you stay there. No desk, no owner, no accountability, no help. Never, ever stay here, ever. Ever.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Horrible”
Reviews.Author: AggieJulie2006
Reviews.Content: I thought everyone else was just too picky--but yep, this place is horrible. My husband and I are in our 20's and often stay in hole in the wall places for 20 or 30 bucks a night,but this place was definitely the worst place we have ever stayed. 1. No one will help --there is no front desk 2. You are given 2 towels to use for however long you plan to stay. Unfortunately we had to stay for 7 nights...if you are going to the beach everyday, 2 towels is definitely not enough. 3. There is a girl who can "help" in an office next door for about 2 hours a day. She has a horrible attitude and does not give a crap. 4. Room was musty 5. Sheets didn't fit the bed 6. Bed was horribly uncomfortable 7. I didn't feel safe at all--anyone can just walk in to the hotel 8. The bar downstairs will keep you up until 2am...since the floor will be vibrating 9. People are loud outside since that is where the ferry is--late at night and early in the morning 10. Floor is dirty 11. The bathroom is pretty far from Room #4--even though it is advertised as being in the same hallway 12. No soap

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: albertodones
Reviews.Content: First of all, this place does not have someone to help you over the phone. Everything is done by internet and there is no person to help you in case something goes wrong. If that is the way you like to be treated stay in Hotel Kokomo. Michael the person who helped me over emails,explain to me thats the way they handle there business.They had on hold my amex for 9 days. Since he was in europe he could not help me making the reservation. Finally i had 700.00 dollars on hold on my credit card , i cold not stay in the place because the person was handling his business from europe, and he never return a single call to me. There are better places to stay in culebra, DO NOT STAY HERE...

Reviews.Title: “Can I choose zero star?”
Reviews.Author: SydnieLi
Reviews.Content: This is my worst stay EVER, which is even worse than experiences in some $10 guesthouse in Bangkok. I knew I wouldn't expect much, but I was still astonished by what we were given. We stayed in Room 2 for 2 nights. Everything looked old (well I was fine with this part). One cabinet was wrapped using sealing tape so that the doors wouldn't fall apart. There's no comforter or blanket but a super thin sheet on the bed. There's NO hot water. We couldn't get help because it was 10 pm when we found it out and there's not anything like front desk to call. Unfortunately this was not the worst part of that night. Our room was right above a bar. I can clearly feel the floor shaking because of the music and hear ten different conversations going on. It was sooo noisy and didn't finish until 2 am. We had to go for a diving trip on 8:30 am the next morning. We complained to the guy in Vacation Planners about the hot water issue after diving and he sent someone to our room. The person checked and made sure there's no hot water (yes we knew that!). He said he was going to check outside and never showed up again. We were told that the pipe burst and we would not get hot water before we checked out. So the take home message is: this place (I wouldn't call it hotel) is highly NOT recommended. Stay somewhere else or just camp!

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet at Kokomo”
Reviews.Author: citymaven
Reviews.Content: There is a bar on the first floor of the hotel, called the Sandbagger (Sand-something anyway), which has one of the biggest sound systems I have ever seen, which is utilized to full potential on Saturday nights up until 2am. So if you are looking for a good night's sleep over the weekend, this is not the place. The bartender, who was a skinny American girl with straight long blond hair, charged us $24 for two medalla beers and one rum and coke, which makes it higher than big hotel prices. We were drunk and did not argue, but watch out!

Reviews.Title: “Horriable!!! Do not stay here.”
Reviews.Author: packer2
Reviews.Content: For the price of $229 for the "best" room, we could have had a house on the beach. The bed nearly reached the floor in the middle. I finally moved to the sofa which was nearly as bad. Sheets were so old and wouldn't stay on the bed, found that we were sleeping on the plastic underneath, YUCK! The shower spewed water into the wall and out into the kitchen - 3" on the floor. Couldn't open the windows as the cranks fell off. The overhead fan was so old that the paddles were warping. Couldn't check in until 3-4:00. The gal at the desk didn't show up until 4:30. Postage stamp size towels no soap. Air conditioning in the back room only and very very noisy. I wanted to contact the owner, who is someone in NY whose name was not available to us. Doubt that we will ever see our $50 deposit.

Reviews.Title: “Kokomo... NEVER AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: MPR_PR
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation at Kokomo, we knew we weren't staying in a fancy place, but called to make sure if both rooms in the PH suite had AC. They told us both rooms did, and when we arrived we found ourselves with one room with AC. We complained, but they told us that because we made our reservation through the Internet we had to call a place in New York. Just to get us out of the way the administrator (the American guy) told us that he would send someone to" fix it" (I'm back in PR and still waiting). To be able to have a good night sleep we took the fan from the outside room and brought it to one that had the AC... did I mention it didn't work properly? We had an awesome couples PJ party... YEY =C. Two days had passed since our first complain and we saw the administrator again at the bar underneath the hotel. My friend decided to asked him for the technician that he â€œwas going to sendâ€�, but he exploded and began to yell, plus threatened to call the police. I'm a Puerto Rican who has lived in the States and PR. I have NEVER in the past been treated this way. This is the type of people my Puerto Rico doesnâ€™t need. They come, establish a shop, bar, or guesthouse (whatever) and treat people like garbage. We need people who welcome and promote good tourism. Culebra is a paradise with nice and welcoming LOCAL PEOPLE. If YOU are planning on staying at this hotel I highly suggest NOT TO. Look for another place, or stay camping... believe me, it will be better. THIS PLACE IS A FRAUD!

Reviews.Title: “Find another place”
Reviews.Author: maponte1
Reviews.Content: The pictures of the place don't give an idea of the dark,dirty,hot(ac was broken) and disgusting place this so called hotel is,find another place,I booked two nights and stayed one ,when asked for refund they gave me all this b.s., in other words they make it pretty dificult...Again not worth even the modest price.

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard beds, bugs, difficult staff”
Reviews.Author: backpacker1984R
Reviews.Content: The bed was just a wooden slab with a comforter. Really. There was no mattress. Impossible to sleep. There were also bugs all over the air conditioner. The staff didn't seem to care at all. This place is the cheapest on the island, but I would recommend spending only $10 more and getting one of the nice bed and breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills--But what more could you ask for in Paradise?”
Reviews.Author: chara810
Reviews.Content: Hotel Kokomo is right across the street from where the Ferry drops you off in Culebra. Its bare bones as far as ammenities--a bed, some drawers, a bathroom, and the brightest hot pink walls you've seen in your life to match the flamencos on the headboard. You're around the corner from good food--and a short Publico ride from Flamenco Beach, THE most beautiful beach in the world. The staff are friendly and hospitable, the rooms are very clean and its quiet at night. My only heads up is to keep in touch with the front desk before you arrive, their hours are inconsistent from day to day and if you're running a little late, they might not be there, and they don't always answer the phone that they post on the door to call.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it!”
Reviews.Author: worldtravels2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kokomo in 2007 and enjoyed it very much. It was close to everything in town. The hotel/motel is no frills place, decent beds and space and I believe it was one of the very few places you can stay at with private bathrooms at that price range. When we go back to Culebra we plan on staying at the Kokomo again. The taxi vans ran from Kokomo to Flamenco beach for $1-2 per person back in 2007. This is not a standard hotel or motel with a front desk, we checked in at the office next door and they were also very helpful with any questions/requests we had. Overall, our best vacation ever! WE LOVE CULEBRA!

Reviews.Title: “I don't care if you want cheap, don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: DeniseMF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Kokomo 2 nights, fully knowing that we were just using it as a place to crash at night. We stayed in room number 7, which was just big enough for a full size bed (if that's what you call an old wooden frame with a 2 inch thick mattress) with one sheet and had a tiny dollhouse sized bathroom. I felt dirty from the moment I walked in the room, the only thing remotely positive was that we had airconditioning. We had read the reviews (unfortunatly after we booked the room) that said there were sugar ants, and they were correct. There were major amounts of sugar ants, all over the walls, especially in the bathroom & on the last day we saw them in our bed (eeww! i'm getting itchy just thinking about it!). I could barely shower the 2nd day because it felt so dirty, and by the last day the stench was so bad I had to hold my breath when in the room. If you are going to Culebra for the beaches, spend the extra money and get a nice place, don't waste your money at Kokomo. I don't know how they are still in business. It almost ruined our experience on the island, I would NEVER reccomend this place to anyone- no matter how cheap it is!!!

Reviews.Title: “Near the ferry ...and everything else on Culebra”
Reviews.Author: LimeRed
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Kokomo a few nights. Sure, this is probably not the Ritz (I wouldnâ€™t know) but itâ€™s a decent place to crash and the island of Culebra is such a beautiful place and the people there (locals and most of the tourists) are so friendly that you donâ€™t care. There is a bed. You can have a shower and the staff is friendly. If you want a spa, a tennis court and a wellness center â€“ go somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “stay away this place should be closed down”
Reviews.Author: dsanchez9
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay here you are better off camping out at Flamenco Beach. This is the worst place I ever stepped in. My family and I just reserved it for the day to have a place to shower and change before our flight. They do not even provide soap nor complementary shampoo. The room is so dumpy looking and not even a tv. I recommend just camping out or just visit the island for the day. Try A- 1 VACATION first. I have never been so upset and I will make sure every travel site is aware of this. This place is no place for a family. I do know how this type of place can exisit. This place should be shut down. Please take my advice. For what this cost $85.00 a nite you can find something better.

Reviews.Title: “the black spot of our Culebra holiday”
Reviews.Author: Taxidiarenia
Reviews.Content: The first surprise upon arriving at this 'hotel' was that it wasnt even open for us to drop off our stuff. The place offers no breakfast and opens up when convenient to the owners around 10:30-11am. It also closes at about 5pm, as well as for a good long lunch break. The second surprise after seeing our rooms (we had the big penthouse, with a lovely view of the harbour indeed, but that was pretty much all there was to it), was that the owners had overcharged us!(our only consolation when we saw the rooms was that at least we weren't paying that much for it, but that idea soon colapsed when we checked our bank accounts(140$ for a crappy hotel). The experience itself in the rooms left much to be desired for: lamps that didnt work, sheets that hadnt been changed for decades, a feeling of overall dirtiness; The place is badly in need of restoration. Despite some amateur efforts to bring some colour in the room, it was far from what we had envisaged. It was obviously a business with little respect to the client. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: andrewsspam
Reviews.Content: We stayed in #12 at Hotel Kokomo, which is one of the two "penthouse" suites. Good: the pictures were great and the location was pretty good. The view from the balcony was amazing. It was huge, and great for entertaining some of the people we met on the ferry over. The kitchen was nice to have, too, although the cooking utensils weren't very good. Bad: Our rooms were infested with sugar ants and some sort of biting insects - I believe fleas, although I'm not sure. Regardless, while washing dishes in the morning I got 24 bug bites on my ankles, feet and calves. There was only air conditioning in one back room. This made the front rooms unbearably hot to sleep in. Most of the lights didn't work, and the people at the front desk/office acted surprised. They didn't try to fix them, though. It's a bit of a walk to anywhere in the town (although it's very small). We spent a lot of time at Mamacita's, and after the first night we actually moved there to stay because of the problems at Kokomo. (I'd recommend Mamacita's over Kokomo in a heartbeat. It's not perfect, but it's much nicer.) The furniture was generally dirty. There wasn't really a lock on the door - it was a tiny, cheap padlock that could be smashed open quite easily. The doors also didn't slide well, so it was almost impossible to lock up the apartment.

Reviews.Title: “Needs extensive updating!!!”
Reviews.Author: rjsmom1117
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the long wait time, we were still waiting on the remaining amount of our refund..... (still have not got). After getting off the ferry from Fajardo and arriving at Culebra, we found that our hotel was right across the street from the ferry dock. Two of my girlfriends and I rented the "Sailfish" room at the Hotel Kokomo after seeing the room on the hotel's website. It was not at all like the pictures. I think these photos must of been taken when the hotel was brand new. Once we figured out that we had to enter the "vacation planner" door to check into the hotel we were on the right track. We were met by a nice female who gave us our room key and directions to get to the room. You have to enter a separate door, and climb two flights of unstable stairs to get to the top floor where our room was. Our room was secured by a small padlock (not comforting for 3 females not from the area). Once we entered we were upset by the quality of the room. We knew we would not be staying at the Ritz-Calton but the room was full of stains all over the furniture (so much so that you could not find a clean place to sit anywhere on the couches) and the walls had stains and also the ceilings. (See photos) The only positive things I can say about the whole room was the bathroom looked like it had been updated in the last few years. The bedroom was also the same with the stains and also had a door but no stairs to get down?? (from the third floor). Once entrace both in and out. There were windows in the livingroom covered in plywood (not sure why??). The kitchen was a wreck, I am not sure who would want to attempt to cook in there. There was an overwhelming smell of mold in the rooms. We decided we could not stay there and went back to the desk for a refund to stay somewhere else. We were told that we would have to contact the owner directly (in New York I think). After several attemps to contact him, we left a message saying we were going to post on trip advisor and got called right back. He said that he would refund our money but when I said I was still going to post my review he was yelling at me and hung up on me. We did get all but $50 back, (not sure why he kept that amount?) I would strongly suggest looking at the B&B/inns for Culebra, there are a lot of other places to stay. I have friends who have stayed at Mamasitas and said it is very clean. Feel free to email me with any questions. Even after that drama I would still go back to Culebra (staying at Mamasitas or similar)-- it's an amazingly beautiful island!!! We had a great time eating at Mamasitas and spending the day at Flamenco Beach ( I can see why it's rated one of the best in the world) and can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible, but I'd try another guest house”
Reviews.Author: Madisonlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: Thought it would be a decent place located right off of the ferry, and it was. But since the whole island is only 7 miles long or so, you can walk, take a taxi for $2 per person, or rent a jeep for $40 a day. The rooms were modest...had beds and a bathroom, no TV/clock/phone. One person in our group complained about hearing the ferry come in early in the morning, but it never woke me up. We did have an unfortunate night that my boyfriend woke up at 3:00 in the morning to discover that the fans and AC were off and it was 85 degrees in our room. Pretty miserable night because none of us could get to sleep, but we found out the next morning that the power went out on the whole island (since it runs on generators). We saw some cuter guesthouses closer "into the city", but beaware, the ones on the water tend to attract more bugs. Mamacitas has a restaurant and bar within that seemed nice when we were there for dinner. Villa Flamenco is right next to Flamenco Beach one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, so that might not be a bad idea either. I'd think you could travel to Culebra and find a decent place to stay, without booking in advance. They all seem to be reasonably priced. Then you'd be sure to have a place you'd be happy with. Beware: We took a nap after being on the beach all day, and when we woke up to eat around 8:30...the city was dead. Everything was closed! Hotels have a policy that if they serve food, they stop serving at 9 and must close the bar at 10. Considering there are about 3 restaurants (Mamacitas, Dingy Dock, and El Eden---which has fabulous sandwiches) and 3 bars, (the ones listed above), it may be good to bring your own food. Oh, there was a Chinese restaurant that we managed to eat at as it was closing up. Not exactly an ideal dinner. If you're looking for a secluded island with beautiful beaches and aren't looking for luxury in any form, Culebra is the place for you. Or else, take a day trip to Culebra from Fajardo and stay at the Fajardo Inn of Scenic Inn (same hotel, Scenic Inn is a guest house for walk ins only and has the same amenities of the hotel), or the Ritzier El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “Culebra in general”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Culebra is a beautiful place to stay, when I go at least twice a year I usually stay in a house close to zoni beach, I rent private home, this is what I like to do when I go there, this place is paradise and nothing to do but RELAX all day long, is like meditation and food for the soul. If you want to truly relax and enjoy real nature stay far away from town, rent a home, a little expensive but worth it and enjoy the views, crystal clear water and the solitude with whoever you decide to go with if not alone. This is a real vacation, NATURE and PARADISE. No luxuries, no one to bother you, just you, the beautiful sea, the night incredible amazing views of stars and breeze, and wake up to the looking at the sea, alone noone near you, I personally love this.

Reviews.Title: “a weekend in culebra”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i lived in puerto rico for about 2 years in the past, and naturally, my friends and i wanted to see the neighboring islands. one weekend, we decided to go to culebra, and ended up staying at the Hotel Kokomo. one thing alot of people need to realize is vacationing somewhere like this isn't like being back in the states. if you want the comforts of home, stay on the mainland and go to the Conquistador. if you want to experience something different, Hotel Kokomo is a good place to start. there are no TVs or phones, and the maid serivice isn't going to wash your clothes for you. there is no airconditioning, just like most of the homes in the area, including where i lived for 2 years. to be quite honest, my friends and i were impressed with the room we got for the money we paid. we stayed on the top floor on the balcony overlooking the ferry. we had three beds and two couches, more than enough room for all of us. we had a kitchenette, and a bathroom. when you're spending a weekend somwhere trying to have a good time experienceing the island, do you really need anything else? the rooms aren't designed for you to stay in the all day long, they're somwhere to sleep and clean up before you go out exploring. granted, the security made me a little nervous. the room we stayed in didn't even have a lock on the sliding door. all we had was a gate at the bottom of the stairs, which i eaisly jumped around when i forgot my key. we never had a problem, and none of us had any need to bring valuables along, so we were prettty much fine. all in all, i'd have to say that i really enjoyed my stay at Hotel Kokomo, and the reason most people won't give it as good of reviews as i would is because they simply aren't familiar with the culture in that area. they don't know that if you don't want to pay an arm and a leg for a place to stay, this is what you're going to get.

Reviews.Title: “Word of Caution if you stay at this Motel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Kokomo on May 19th, 2004. We knew we were not going to the Ritz but never dreamed that we would be staying at a place that has only one lock on the door and others may have the exact key to your place. We were going to sleep that night and I was a bit worried about having only one lock on the door. It didn't appear to be safe. I was thinking about putting a chair or some heavy table in front of the door. While I laid awake contemplating if I should do that I looked over at the door and notice that the door knob was turning and the door was starting to open. My husband and I immediately jumped out of bed and threw ourselves onto the door and slammed it shut, my husband yelled out "Who are you and what do you want!" Whoever it was never said a word and split. It was a super scary moment for us and there was really nowhere for us to go since it was late at night and just about everyone in the town was closed down for the night. We called the owner of the place and he immediately came to our aid. He does not stay at Hotel Kokomo, he lives about a half hour away from there. He felt terrible about the whole thing and he moved us to another room facing the street and next to the office. It didn't help ease my fear of someone having a key to that room as well. Since we were pretty much stuck there for the night we had no choice but to stay there. We put a table in front of the door and I pretty much stayed awake for that night. This place is not a place I would recommend to anyone. Until this new management gets their act together, I think its not a safe place to stay. I also learned that this owner had just bought the place about 3 weeks ago and he has a lot of work to do there. For one thing he needs to change all the locks and put in an extra security lock or chain on top of the one that is on the door. We also had no hot water at all. There is no phone or TV and you will only get one towel per person and that is it. I think for the little bit you get there it is a little expensive. I would probably never consider staying there again. We called the cops that night and just from what they were saying it doesn't sound like the people there are bad at all, and from what they were gathering it sounded more like some drug attic wanted to just find a place to crash for the night and probably has done so many night, since he does have a key to that room (#7). We were planning on staying two nights there, but after that we decided to head back to Puerto Rico and just stay there instead. Oh another thing the streets there are under major construction and it is very very hard to get to and from there. I mean the streets are all dug up! Plus you will be awaken by all the construction noise that begins at about 6AM.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This trip was done on somewhat of a budget, so $70 a night on Culebra was about the limit of what we were willing to spend. The room was very big, but there was no hot water, nor was there ever any explanation or warning to that effect. There was also no AC, but due to the fan and the tradewinds, this wasn't a problem. No TV or phone, but like most people on this island, we didn't really care or want either. This hotel is in a pretty good location, right by the ferry and not very far from cafes and bars. The room was pretty clean, just don't expect any frills or a super-accomodating staff.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Kokomo
HotelInfo.Address: At the Ferry Terminal | Dewey, Puerto Rico
